data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3551389,"name":"Leo \u0026 Mali","username":"SeansCoolerFriend","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seanscoolerfriend/{size}/232971_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T20:45:26.893Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWhen we call our elevator \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePID\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Proportional Integral Derivative\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e the first time it goes to the correct height. However, successive calls make the elevator overshoot by a lot (like approaching max height and pretty much double the setpoint). We’ve tried resetting the encoder values everytime we send the elevator to the lowest position, as well as not resetting the encoder values. We starting printing values to the console, and it seems that the second call is just running less and the encoder values are not updating. Both kI and kD are zero. This is the code we’ve been using to test: \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/warroboticss/Fluke2025\" class=\"inline-onebox\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eGitHub - warroboticss/Fluke2025: our super cool! If you’re using Krakens on the elevator, you’ve gotta use \u003ca href=\"https://v6.docs.ctr-electronics.com/en/stable/docs/api-reference/device-specific/talonfx/motion-magic.html\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eMotionMagic®\u003c/a\u003e or the motors don’t behave at all. I’ve snapped a zip tie off with regular \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePID\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Proportional Integral Derivative\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e before, and using this stuff fixed it. It’s a bit finnicky to tune though. For the elevator, expect a \u003cem\u003ereally\u003c/em\u003e high P value (we have ours at 60 right now and it’s not fast enough yet), but be sure to work up to it.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eBe
